comment: Not really. Hair that falls out grows back in with a tapered tip so it's thinner at the end. When you shave, you're slicing through a hair at full thickness. So it feels thicker, but only because you cut it across instead of waiting for it to fall out or plucking/waxing it out and letting it grow back in with a thin tip.
